title: Pesto Chicken Quinoa Bowl
description: A bright, protein-packed bowl featuring herbaceous basil pesto-marinated chicken served over fluffy quinoa with roasted cherry tomatoes, baby spinach and a lemony finish. Quick skillet-cooked chicken and simple roasted veg make this an easy weeknight lunch or dinner with fresh Mediterranean flavors.

ingredients.display_name: boneless skinless chicken breasts (trimmed and halved if large)
ingredients.notes: trim excess fat, slice into 1" cutlets if thick
rinsed under cold water to remove saponins
reserve 2 tbsp for finishing if desired
lightly wilt into warm quinoa or serve raw
zest and 1 tbsp juice for dressing, remaining juice optional
for chicken marinade and quinoa flavor
toast in dry skillet until fragrant
adjust to taste; for quinoa and chicken seasoning

steps.text: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C). Toss halved cherry tomatoes with 1 tablespoon olive oil, a pinch of salt and a little black pepper on a rimmed baking sheet and roast until blistered and slightly caramelized.

While oven heats, rinse quinoa in a fine mesh sieve under cold water. Combine rinsed quinoa and water or broth in a saucepan, bring to a boil, reduce to a simmer, cover and cook until liquid is absorbed and quinoa is fluffy.
Pat chicken dry and season with salt and pepper. In a bowl, coat chicken with most of the pesto (reserve some for finishing) and minced garlic; let sit for 5 minutes while skillet heats.

Heat remaining olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add pesto-coated chicken and cook until golden and cooked through, about 4-6 minutes per side depending on thickness. Transfer to a cutting board and rest.
If quinoa is done, fluff with a fork and stir in lemon zest, lemon juice and a small spoonful of reserved pesto to taste. Add baby spinach and gently toss to wilt slightly from the residual heat.

Slice rested chicken and assemble bowls with a base of pesto quinoa, topped with sliced chicken, roasted tomatoes, toasted pine nuts, grated parmesan and a drizzle of extra pesto or olive oil. Finish with additional lemon juice, salt and pepper to taste.
